race.name: Gravel Burn
race.tagline: South African highveld classic—100km of red dirt roads, 2,500m elevation, stunning Mpumalanga scenery.

terrain.primary: South African highveld—rolling red dirt gravel
terrain.surface: 85% gravel, 15% dirt roads. South African highveld—rolling terrain, red dirt roads. 2,500 m over 100 km. Scenic Mpumalanga. Technical rating: 3/5.

biased_opinion.summary: Gravel Burn is South African highveld classic—100 km, 2,500 m elevation. Founded ~2018. 85% gravel, 15% dirt. Red dirt roads (iconic South African). Rolling highveld terrain. 500-700 riders. Mpumalanga scenic region. October spring conditions (15-30°C). Affordable entry (R1,500-R2,000 / $80-$110). If you want African gravel adventure with stunning scenery, this is it. If you want local/domestic race, skip it. International destination race.
biased_opinion.bottom_line: Gravel Burn is South African red dirt adventure. 100 km, 2,500 m, stunning highveld scenery. If you want African gravel destination race with affordable entry, this is it. If you want local/domestic, skip it. International travel required but worth it for scenery and experience.

black_pill.title: INTERNATIONAL TRAVEL + REMOTE LOCATION + HEAT
black_pill.reality: International travel to South Africa required. Johannesburg airport 250 km (3-hour drive) to Mpumalanga. Remote location. October heat (up to 30°C). 2,500 m elevation over 100 km = steep. You'll pay $1,500+ total (flights + entry + lodging + travel). If you need local/domestic, this isn't it. If you want African adventure with stunning scenery, this is it. Affordable entry ($80-$110) but travel adds up.
black_pill.expectation_reset: Gravel Burn is international destination race. South Africa travel required. Remote Mpumalanga location. If you need local/domestic, skip it. If you want African gravel adventure with stunning scenery and affordable entry, this is it. Travel adds cost but experience is unique.

logistics.travel_summary: Fly to Johannesburg (JNB). Rental car needed (250 km, 3-hour drive to Mpumalanga). Book lodging early. Day-before packet pickup. Race October.
logistics.food_options: Aid stations on course. Post-race party.

course_description.character: 100 km, 2,500 m. 85% gravel, 15% dirt. South African highveld—rolling red dirt roads. Technical rating: 3/5.

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Highveld Rolling Terrain
suffering_zones.description: Rolling South African highveld. 2,500 m cumulative. Red dirt roads.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: Pace conservatively. Low gears. Hydrate (heat risk up to 30°C).

suffering_zones.name: Throughout: Heat Management
suffering_zones.description: October spring = 15-30°C. Heat risk. Sun exposure.
suffering_zones.survival_strategy: 3+ bottles. Hydrate at every aid. Sun protection. Manage heat.

course_description.signature_challenge: South African highveld rolling terrain + October heat. Red dirt roads.

history.origin_story: Gravel Burn founded ~2018. South African highveld gravel. 100 km, 500-700 riders. Mpumalanga. Red dirt roads. Growing international field.
history.reputation: South African gravel classic. Highveld red dirt. International destination.
